lead_paragraph: The $20 billion fund created by BP to pay damages from the 2010 spill in the Gulf of Mexico has stopped making payments until the judge overseeing the sprawling federal court litigation clarifies a recent order. Judge Carl J. Barbier in New Orleans ruled on Dec. 29 that settlements reached since Nov. 7 must provide 6 percent of the “gross settlement amount” to an escrow account for certain litigation expenses of plaintiffs’ lawyers. In a letter to Judge Barbier, David Pitofsky, the lead counsel for the fund, asked the judge whether, among other questions, his ruling means that people who have already received money should be forced to give some of it back. “We feel compelled by the court’s order to freeze payments to eligible claimants until we get clarification from the court,” said Kenneth R. Feinberg, administrator of the fund.

headline.main: Louisiana: BP Cleanup Payments on Hold
